body.p: NOTE: This font is ready for use but is still being reviewed and corrected so it should be used critically.
Oracc LAK is a fontification of A. Deimel, Liste der archaischen Keilschriftzeichen (WVDOG 40; Berlin 1922).
There is an Oracc List-Font Data page which provides alignnment information relating LAK to OSL and Unicode.

PNG files of individual LAK signs were excerpted from a scanned copy by Steve Tinney. They were turned into SVG files by Vijay Kethana and are available at https://github.com/vkethana/cuneiform_convert.

Steve Tinney aligned the SVG filenames with Unicode and created an initial TrueType font from the SVG files. This font is still under development: it has been roughly resized and recentered but requires further tuning. Some glyphs from the secondary boxes have been added to the font as salt variants and more will be added in the near future.
Oracc LAK is licensed under the SIL Open Font License, Version 1.1.
All of the Oracc fonts are downloadable from the Oracc II GitHub repository.
Oracc-LAK makes use of salt to differentiate glyph variants of the same sign. It also uses several Stylistic Sets (sset) as follows:

dl.dd: Sign-forms from ED IIIa Fara texts. LAK sometimes uses earlier forms or forms from stone objects (especially the Blau monuments) as the reference glyph. Selecting ss01 ensures that ED IIIa forms from tablets are used.
This set selects forms from the Blau monuments--not all of these have been included in the font as yet.
A few Abu-Salabikh forms from Krebernik's OBO 160/1
A few Ebla forms from Krebernik's OBO 160/1

body.p: In Oracc projects the font is selected with the CSS class ofs-lak.
